meanings.def: used with uncountable or plural nouns in negative sentences and questions, after if or whether, and after some verbs such as prevent, ban, forbid, etc. to refer to an amount or a number of something, however large or small
examples: I didn't eat any meat.
Are there any stamps?
I've got hardly any money.
You can't go out without any shoes.
He forbids any talking in class.
She asked if we had any questions.

meanings.def: used with singular countable nouns to refer to one of a number of things or people, when it does not matter which one
examples: Take any book you like.
Any colour will do.
Any teacher will tell you that students learn at different rates.

meanings.def: used to show that somebody/something is special
examples: It isn't just any day—it's my birthday!

meanings.def: used in negative sentences and in questions and after if or whether to refer to an amount or a number, however large or small
examples: We need some more paint; there isn't any left.
I need some stamps. Are there any in your bag?
Please let me know how many people are coming, if any.
She spent hardly any of the money.
He returned home without any of the others.

meanings.def: one or more of a number of people or things, especially when it does not matter which
examples: I'll take any you don't want.
‘Which colour do you want?’ ‘Any of them will do.’

meanings.def: somebody is not interested or does not agree
examples: I suggested sharing the cost, but he wasn't having any of it.

idioms.def: somebody is not interested or does not agree
examples: I suggested sharing the cost, but he wasn't having any of it.

meanings.def: used to emphasize an adjective or adverb in negative sentences or questions, meaning ‘at all’
examples: He wasn't any good at French.
I can't run any faster.
Is your father feeling any better?
I don't want any more.
If you don't tell them, nobody will be any the wiser (= they will not find out about it).

meanings.def: used at the end of a negative sentence to mean ‘at all’
examples: That won't hurt you any.
